sentences.chinese: 我们在谈话过程中得知鲍勃坐过牢。

sentences.english: We had fish for the main course.
sentences.chinese: 我们的主菜是鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a series of lessons in a particular subject

sentences.english: It could not be proved in a court of law.
sentences.chinese: 这无法在法庭上证实。

sentences.english: The court case lasted six weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这场诉讼持续了六个星期。

sentences.english: Four people will appear in court today, charged with fraud.
sentences.chinese: 今天将有四个人因被指控犯有欺诈罪出庭受审。

sentences.english: The court ruled that no compensation was due.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判决不予赔偿。

sentences.english: She threatened to take the magazine to court (= take legal action against them ) if they didn’t publish an immediate apology.
sentences.chinese: 她威胁说如果这家杂志不立刻刊登道歉声明，她就要把他们告上法庭。

detailed_translations.english: the place where a trial is held, or the people there, especially the judge and the jury who examine the evidence and decide whether someone is guilty or not guilty

name: cousin
trans: 堂兄弟姊妹；表兄弟姊妹

sentences.english: My cousin Mark helped me to bring in the bags.
sentences.chinese: 我表弟马克帮我把包提了进来。

detailed_translations.english: the child of your uncle or aunt

sentences.english: I’d just returned from covering the Cambodian war.
sentences.chinese: 我刚报道完柬埔寨战争回来。

detailed_translations.english: to report the details of an event for a newspaper or a television or radio programme

name: covered
trans: adj. 大量的有遮盖物的;(尤指)有顶的

sentences.english: Our cow is carrying again.
sentences.chinese: 我家的母牛又怀胎了。

sentences.english: The cow is expected to calve next week.
sentences.chinese: 这头母牛预期下周生小牛。

sentences.english: The cow cast a calf.
sentences.chinese: 这头母牛早产了。

detailed_translations.english: a large female animal that is kept on farms and used to produce milk or meat

name: crash
trans: 撞碎；坠毁；破产；轰隆声；睡觉
摔碎；坠落；发出隆隆声；(金融企业等)破产

sentences.english: We watched the waves crashing against the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着海浪哗啦哗啦地冲击岩石。

sentences.english: The plates went crashing to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 盘子哗啦一声摔落到地上。

sentences.english: A large branch came crashing down .
sentences.chinese: 一根大树枝啪啦一声掉落下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倒下，坠落；发出撞击声；垮台，破产
detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone extremely hard while moving, in a way that causes a lot of damage or makes a lot of noise
to have an accident in a car, plane etc by violently hitting something else
a sudden loud noise made by something falling, breaking etc

sentences.english: The neighbours must think we’re crazy.
sentences.chinese: 邻居一定会认为我们疯了。

sentences.english: It’s an absolutely crazy idea .
sentences.chinese: 那绝对是个荒唐的想法。

sentences.english: I know this idea sounds crazy , but it may be worth a try.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这个主意听起来很荒唐，但也许值得一试。

sentences.english: He often works 12 hours a day – it’s crazy .
sentences.chinese: 他常常一天工作12个小时——简直疯了。

detailed_translations.english: very strange or not sensible

name: cream
trans: 奶油，乳脂；精华；面霜；乳酪

sentences.english: fresh cream
sentences.chinese: 鲜奶油

sentences.english: strawberries and cream
sentences.chinese: 浇奶油的草莓

sentences.english: cream silk stockings
sentences.chinese: 乳白色的长筒丝袜

detailed_translations.english: a thick yellow-white liquid that rises to the top of milk

sentences.english: Some people believe the universe was created by a big explosion.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为宇宙是通过一次大爆炸创造出来的。

sentences.english: Her behaviour is creating a lot of problems.
sentences.chinese: 她的行为引起了很多问题。

sentences.english: The new factory is expected to create more than 400 new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这家新工厂预计能创造400多个新的就业机会。

sentences.english: The announcement only succeeded in creating confusion.
sentences.chinese: 那通告反而引起了混乱。

detailed_translations.english: to make something exist that did not exist before

name: creation
trans: 创造， 创建； 创造的作品， 产物； 宇宙， 天地万物 (n.)

sentences.english: a job creation scheme
sentences.chinese: 创造就业机会的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 创造， 创建； 创造的作品， 产物； 宇宙， 天地万物
detailed_translations.english: the act of creating something

name: creative
trans: 有创造力的，创造性的，创作的

sentences.english: This job is so boring. I wish I could do something more creative.
sentences.chinese: 这工作太单调了，我希望能做些更有创造性的事情。

sentences.english: I teach creative writing at Trinity College.
sentences.chinese: 我在三一学院教创意写作。

sentences.english: the creative process of writing a poem
sentences.chinese: 写诗的创作过程

sentences.english: Diaghilev did his great creative work in France.
sentences.chinese: 狄亚格列夫在法国编创了富有创新性的伟大作品。

sentences.english: a creative solution to the problem
sentences.chinese: 这一问题的创新性解决方法

detailed_translations.english: involving the use of imagination to produce new ideas or things

name: creature
trans: 动物；（有特性或特质的）人

sentences.english: all the living creatures in the sea
sentences.chinese: 海洋中所有的生物

detailed_translations.english: anything that is living, such as an animal, fish, or insect, but not a plant

name: credit
trans: 信任，可信性；赞扬，荣誉，功劳；信用，信贷；赊购

sentences.english: We found his statement hard to credit.
sentences.chinese: 我们觉得他的说法令人难以信服。

sentences.english: The witness’s story gained credit with the jury.
sentences.chinese: 证人的陈述被陪审团采信了。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true
the belief that something is true or correct

sentences.english: The plane crashed, killing two of the crew and four passengers.
sentences.chinese: 飞机坠毁，造成两名机组人员和四名乘客死亡。

sentences.english: a crew member
sentences.chinese: 一名机组人员

detailed_translations.english: all the people who work on a ship or plane

name: crime
trans: 罪行，犯罪；罪恶；犯罪活动

sentences.english: We moved here because there was very little crime.
sentences.chinese: 我们搬到这里来是因为这里的犯罪率很低。

sentences.english: Police officers are being given new powers to help combat crime.
sentences.chinese: 警官们被赋予新的权力帮助他们打击犯罪。

sentences.english: a police crackdown on car crime
sentences.chinese: 警察对汽车犯罪活动的一次严厉打击

sentences.english: a town with a relatively low crime rate
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率相对较低的一个城镇

detailed_translations.english: illegal activities in general

sentences.english: Experts cannot agree on the causes of criminal behaviour .
sentences.chinese: 专家对犯罪行为的原因不能取得一致意见。

sentences.english: I was sure he was involved in some kind of criminal activity .
sentences.chinese: 我肯定他在从事某种犯罪活动。

sentences.english: She has not committed a criminal offence (= a crime ) .
sentences.chinese: 她没有犯罪。

sentences.english: He was arrested and charged with criminal damage (= damaging someone’s property illegally ) .
sentences.chinese: 他遭到逮捕并被指控犯有刑事损坏罪。

sentences.english: The doctor was found guilty of criminal negligence (= not taking enough care to protect people you are responsible for ) .
sentences.chinese: 这名医生被判过失犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: relating to crime
someone who is involved in illegal activities or has been proved guilty of a crime

sentences.english: The country now faces an economic crisis .
sentences.chinese: 该国目前正面临一场经济危机。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister was criticized for the way in which he handled the crisis .
sentences.chinese: 首相处理危机的方式遭到了批评。

sentences.english: the current debt crisis
sentences.chinese: 当前的债务危机

sentences.english: a major political crisis
sentences.chinese: 重大的政治危机

sentences.english: I was relieved that we had averted yet another financial crisis .
sentences.chinese: 我如释重负，我们又避免了一场财政危机。

sentences.english: Oil companies were heavily criticized when they made large profits during the oil crisis of the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 石油公司因在20世纪70年代的石油危机中赚取了丰厚利润而受到严厉抨击。

sentences.english: The car industry is now in crisis .
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业现在正处于危机之中。

sentences.english: He doesn’t seem to be very good at crisis management .
sentences.chinese: 他好像不大擅长处理危机。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there are a lot of problems that must be dealt with quickly so that the situation does not get worse or more dangerous

name: criterion
trans: （批评判断的）标准；准则；规范；准据

sentences.english: the criteria we use to select candidates
sentences.chinese: 我们挑选候选人的标准

detailed_translations.english: a standard that you use to judge something or make a decision about something

name: critic
trans: 批评者，批评家；爱挑剔的人

sentences.english: Mather was a film critic for many years.
sentences.chinese: 马瑟做过多年的电影评论家。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make judgments about the good and bad qualities of art, music, films etc

name: critical
trans: 批评的，评论的；危急的，紧要的；临界的

sentences.english: He made some highly critical remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他发表了一些严厉的批判性言论。

detailed_translations.english: if you are critical, you criticize someone or something

sentences.english: Despite strong criticism , the new system is still in place.
sentences.chinese: 尽管遭到了猛烈的批评，新制度依然原封不动。

sentences.english: There has been widespread criticism of the decision.
sentences.chinese: 这一决定受到了普遍的批评。

sentences.english: We try to give students constructive criticism .
sentences.chinese: 我们设法对学生提出有建设性的批评。

sentences.english: Another criticism levelled at him was that his teaching methods were old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 还有一个针对他的批评是，他的教学方法已经过时。

sentences.english: The government’s economic strategy has attracted a lot of criticism .
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策招致了大量的批评。

sentences.english: You must learn to accept criticism .
sentences.chinese: 你必须学会接受批评。

sentences.english: Many employees find it hard to take even mild criticism .
sentences.chinese: 有许多员工甚至连轻微的批评也很难接受。

sentences.english: His actions provoked severe criticism from civil rights groups.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为招致了民权组织的严厉批评。

sentences.english: the storm of criticism that followed his announcement
sentences.chinese: 他的声明引来的批评浪潮

sentences.english: literary criticism
sentences.chinese: 文学评论

detailed_translations.english: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something

name: criticise
trans: vt. 批评；吹毛求疵；非难
vi. 批评；吹毛求疵；非难

sentences.english: If you or your partner criticise each other habitually, you are attacking their personality.
sentences.chinese: 如果你或你的伴侣习惯性地批评对方，其实你们是在攻击对方的人格。

sentences.english: The more we criticise a nation in motion the less we have to say about our own sad lost little island.
sentences.chinese: 我们对运转中的国家的批评越多，我们就能更少地谈到我们所在的迷失的小岛。

sentences.english: These papers found it to their advantage, during the unpopularity of Darling, to criticise severely the acts of that Governor, who was defended by the Gazette with intemperate zeal.
sentences.chinese: 这两份报纸发现，基于达令总督的不得人心，他们拥有一大优势：严词批评总督的法令，和《公报》的过分阿谀拍马对着干。

sentences.english: The main crops were oats and barley.
sentences.chinese: 主要作物是燕麦和大麦。

sentences.english: crops grown for market
sentences.chinese: 为供应市场而种植的作物

sentences.english: Fruit growers are gathering in a bumper crop (= a very large amount of something produced in season ) .
sentences.chinese: 果农正在采摘丰收的果实。

detailed_translations.chinese: 农作物，庄稼；一熟：一季的收成
detailed_translations.english: a plant such as wheat, rice, or fruit that is grown by farmers and used as food

name: cross
trans: 交叉，十字；十字架，十字形物
交叉的，相反的；乖戾的；生气的

sentences.english: The by-pass crosses Wilton Lane shortly after a roundabout.
sentences.chinese: 这条旁道绕过环岛后不久就和威尔顿巷相交。

detailed_translations.chinese: 交叉，十字；十字架，十字形物
detailed_translations.english: an upright post of wood with another crossing it near the top, that people in the past were fastened to with nails and left to die on as a punishment
if two or more roads, lines, etc cross, or if one crosses another, they go across each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 交叉的，相反的；乖戾的；生气的
detailed_translations.english: angry or annoyed

name: crowd
trans: 群众,一伙;一堆,许多,大众

sentences.english: A vast crowd gathered in the main square.
sentences.chinese: 主广场上聚集了一大群人。

sentences.english: She mingled with the crowd of guests, exchanging greetings.
sentences.chinese: 她穿梭在宾客中间和他们打招呼。

sentences.english: Saturday’s game was watched by a capacity crowd (= the maximum number of people that a sports ground etc can hold ) .
sentences.chinese: 星期六的比赛座无虚席。

sentences.english: Troops fired tear gas and shots to disperse a crowd of 15,000 demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 军队发射催泪弹并开枪来驱散15,000名示威群众。

sentences.english: I didn’t know him; he wasn’t one of the usual crowd.
sentences.chinese: 我不认识他，他不是平时那一群人里的。

sentences.english: He wanted to go unnoticed, to be one of the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他想默默无闻地做个普通人。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of people who have gathered together to do something, for example to watch something or protest about something

sentences.english: a crowded room
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的房间

sentences.english: a crowded street
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的街道

sentences.english: The train was very crowded, and we had to stand.
sentences.chinese: 火车很挤，我们只好站着。

detailed_translations.english: too full of people or things

sentences.english: The conservation of tropical forests is of crucial importance .
sentences.chinese: 保护热带雨林至关重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

name: cruel
trans: 残酷的，残忍的；使人痛苦的，让人受难的；无情的，严酷的

sentences.english: His death was a cruel blow .
sentences.chinese: 他的死是个无情的打击。

sentences.english: Sometimes life seems unbearably cruel.
sentences.chinese: 有时候生活残酷得让人无法承受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 残酷的，残忍的；使人痛苦的，让人受难的；无情的，严酷的
detailed_translations.english: making someone suffer or feel unhappy

sentences.english: Don’t cry, Laura. It’ll be OK.
sentences.chinese: 不要哭，劳拉，没事的。

sentences.english: Upstairs, a baby began to cry.
sentences.chinese: 楼上有个婴儿开始哭起来。

sentences.english: Jamie looked like he’d been crying.
sentences.chinese: 杰米看上去好像哭过了。

sentences.english: I just couldn’t stop crying.
sentences.chinese: 我就是哭个不停。

sentences.english: That film always makes me cry .
sentences.chinese: 那部影片总是让我落泪。

sentences.english: Oliver, alone, began to cry bitterly (= cry a lot ) .
sentences.chinese: 奥利弗独自一人，开始伤心地哭了。

sentences.english: ‘Stop!’ she cried.
sentences.chinese: “停下！”她喊道。

detailed_translations.english: to produce tears from your eyes, usually because you are unhappy or hurt

sentences.english: the very real historical and cultural differences between our two societies
sentences.chinese: 我们两个社会之间非常现实的历史和文化差异

sentences.english: the desire to maintain a distinct cultural identity
sentences.chinese: 保持独特的文化特征的愿望

sentences.english: It is important to look at the political and cultural context in which the novel was written.
sentences.chinese: 要考虑小说创作时的政治和文化背景，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: people who share the same cultural background
sentences.chinese: 有着相同文化背景的人

detailed_translations.english: belonging or relating to a particular society and its way of life

sentences.english: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.chinese: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.english: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

detailed_translations.english: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society

sentences.english: Mathew picked up the cup and sipped his coffee.
sentences.chinese: 马修拿起杯子抿了口咖啡。

sentences.english: She put her cup and saucer down on the table.
sentences.chinese: 她把杯碟放到桌上。

sentences.english: Breakfast consisted of half a cup of milk and a dry biscuit.
sentences.chinese: 早餐是半杯牛奶和一片干饼干。

sentences.english: The president of the club came to present the cup to the winners.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部主席来给获胜者颁发奖杯。

detailed_translations.english: a small round container, usually with a handle, that you use to drink tea, coffee etc

name: cupboard
trans: 柜橱；  碗碟橱， 食橱

sentences.english: It’s in the kitchen cupboard.
sentences.chinese: 它在厨房的碗柜里。

sentences.english: The cupboard doors were open.
sentences.chinese: 柜门开着。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture with doors, and sometimes shelves, used for storing clothes, plates, food etc

name: cure
trans: 治疗；治愈；使硫化；加工处理
治疗；治愈；[临床] 疗法

sentences.english: Will you be able to cure him, Doctor?
sentences.chinese: 医生，你能把他治好吗？

sentences.english: The new treatment effected a miraculous cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种新疗法产生了奇迹般的疗效。

detailed_translations.english: to make a person or an animal healthy again after an illness
the act of making someone well again after an illness

sentences.english: long dark curly hair
sentences.chinese: 又长又黑的鬈发

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of curls or a curved shape

sentences.english: The bank can supply you with foreign currency .
sentences.chinese: 这家银行能为你提供外币。

sentences.english: There are moves towards a single currency in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲有向单一货币发展的趋势。

sentences.english: The local currency is the Swiss franc.
sentences.chinese: 当地的货币是瑞士法郎。

detailed_translations.english: the system or type of money that a country uses

name: current
trans: 电流；潮流，趋势；当前的，现在的；通用的，流行的，被普遍接受的

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

sentences.english: the products that are currently available
sentences.chinese: 目前供应的产品

sentences.english: He is currently working on his first novel.
sentences.chinese: 他目前正在创作他的第一本小说。

detailed_translations.english: at the present time

sentences.english: red velvet curtains
sentences.chinese: 红色的丝绒窗帘

sentences.english: Before the curtain went up, the dancers took their places on stage.
sentences.chinese: 幕拉起之前，舞蹈演员都在舞台上站好了位置。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of hanging cloth that can be pulled across to cover a window, divide a room etc

name: curve
trans: 曲线；弯曲；曲线球；曲线图表

sentences.english: a sweeping curve of railroad track
sentences.chinese: 铁轨的大弧线

sentences.english: The car took the curve much too quickly.
sentences.chinese: 那辆汽车拐弯太快了。

sentences.english: The track curved round the side of the hill.
sentences.chinese: 小路弯弯曲曲，依山盘旋。

detailed_translations.english: a line that gradually bends like part of a circle
to bend or move in the shape of a curve, or to make something do this

name: custom
trans: n. 习惯，惯例；风俗；海关，关税；经常光顾；（经常性的）顾客

sentences.english: She was stopped at customs and questioned.
sentences.chinese: 她在海关被叫住接受问话。

sentences.english: It took ages to clear customs (= be allowed through customs ) but then we were out of the airport quite quickly.
sentences.chinese: 过海关花了很长时间，不过出机场倒是很快。

sentences.english: You won’t be able to take that through customs.
sentences.chinese: 你带着那东西过不了海关的。

detailed_translations.english: the place where your bags are checked for illegal goods when you go into a country

sentences.english: We aim to offer good value and service to all our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求为所有的客户提供物有所值的商品和服务。

sentences.english: We’ve had several letters from satisfied customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了几封顾客表示满意的来信。

sentences.english: He’s one of our regular customers .
sentences.chinese: 他是我们的一个老主顾。

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys goods or services from a shop, company etc

sentences.english: Do you want me to cut the cake?
sentences.chinese: 要我切蛋糕吗？

sentences.english: They’re introducing CCTV cameras in an attempt to cut street crime in the area.
sentences.chinese: 为了减少该地区的街头犯罪，他们安装了闭路电视摄像机。

sentences.english: You need to cut the amount of fat and sugar in your diet.
sentences.chinese: 你需要减少饮食中脂肪和糖的摄入量。

sentences.english: Scientists are warning that unless carbon emissions are cut, we could be heading for an environmental catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 科学家警告说如果不减少碳排放量，我们可能会面临环境灾难。

sentences.english: Seven hundred jobs will be lost in order to cut costs and boost profits.
sentences.chinese: 为了降低成本，提高利润，将削减700个职位。

sentences.english: The major aviation companies need to cut prices if they are to compete with budget airlines.
sentences.chinese: 大航空公司如果想和廉价的航空公司竞争，就需要降低价格。

sentences.english: Staffing levels had already been cut to the bone (= reduced to the lowest level possible ) .
sentences.chinese: 人员配备已经削减到了最低限度。

detailed_translations.english: to divide something or separate something from its main part, using scissors, a knife etc

name: cycle
trans: 循环；周期；自行车；整套；一段时间

sentences.english: a woman’s menstrual cycle
sentences.chinese: 女性的月经周期

detailed_translations.chinese: 自行车、 摩托车； 循环
detailed_translations.english: a number of related events that happen again and again in the same order

sentences.english: She lives with her mom and dad.
sentences.chinese: 她和爸爸妈妈一起住。

sentences.english: Dad, will you help me?
sentences.chinese: 爸爸，帮我一下好吗？

detailed_translations.english: father

sentences.english: daily flights to Miami
sentences.chinese: 每日飞往迈阿密的航班

sentences.english: China Daily receives dispatches from all parts of the world.
sentences.chinese: 《中国日报》收到世界各地发来的电讯。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done every day
a newspaper that is printed and sold every day, or every day except Sunday

sentences.english: insects that damage crops
sentences.chinese: 破坏庄稼的昆虫

sentences.english: There may be permanent brain damage.
sentences.chinese: 可能有永久性脑损伤。

detailed_translations.english: to cause physical harm to something or to part of someone’s body
physical harm that is done to something or to a part of someone’s body, so that it is broken or injured

sentences.english: Come on, let’s dance.
sentences.chinese: 来吧，我们跳舞吧。

sentences.english: The words danced before her tired eyes.
sentences.chinese: 这些字在她疲乏的眼前晃动。

sentences.english: The waltz is an easy dance to learn.
sentences.chinese: 华尔兹这种舞很容易学。

detailed_translations.english: to move your body to the sound and rhythm of music
a special set of movements performed to a particular type of music

sentences.english: The dancer’s technique is strong.
sentences.chinese: 这个舞蹈演员舞技精湛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 舞蹈家；舞蹈演员；舞女；跳舞者
detailed_translations.english: someone who dances as a profession

sentences.english: All the schools have music and dancing as part of the curriculum.
sentences.chinese: 每个学校都设有音乐课和舞蹈课。

sentences.english: Let's go dancing tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我们今晚去跳舞吧。

detailed_translations.english: When people dance for enjoyment or to entertain others, you can refer to this activity as dancing

sentences.english: Danger! No boats beyond this point.
sentences.chinese: 危险！船只不可越过此处。

sentences.english: The refugees believe that their lives are in danger .
sentences.chinese: 难民认为他们有生命危险。

detailed_translations.english: the possibility that someone or something will be harmed, destroyed, or killed

sentences.english: laws about dangerous dogs
sentences.chinese: 有关危险犬类的法律

sentences.english: Some of these prisoners are extremely dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 这些囚犯中有些极为危险。

sentences.english: The powdered milk was not as good as breast milk, and was downright dangerous (= actually dangerous ) when it was mixed with unclean water.
sentences.chinese: 奶粉没有母乳好，用不洁净的水冲调更会造成危险。

detailed_translations.english: able or likely to harm or kill you

name: dark
trans: 黑暗的，深色的；模糊的；无知的；忧郁的

sentences.english: The church was dark and quiet.
sentences.chinese: 教堂里黑魆魆的，寂静无声。

sentences.english: the dark winter days
sentences.chinese: 阴暗的冬日

sentences.english: Suddenly, the room went dark (= became dark ) .
sentences.chinese: 房间突然变暗了。

sentences.english: (= night begins ) about ten o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 大约十点钟开始天黑。

sentences.english: It was still dark (= was night ) when we boarded the train.
sentences.chinese: 我们上火车时天还是黑的。

sentences.english: It was pitch dark (= completely dark ) in the attic.
sentences.chinese: 阁楼上漆黑一片。

detailed_translations.english: if it is dark, there is little or no light

sentences.english: The research involves collecting data from two random samples.
sentences.chinese: 该项研究需要从两个随机样本里收集资料。

detailed_translations.english: information or facts
information or facts

sentences.english: The date on the letter was 30th August 1962.
sentences.chinese: 信上的日期是1962年8月30日。

sentences.english: What’s today’s date?
sentences.chinese: 今天几号？

sentences.english: Make sure you sign and date it at the bottom.
sentences.chinese: 一定要在底下签上姓名和日期。

detailed_translations.english: a particular day of the month or year, especially shown by a number
to write or print the date on something

sentences.english: She’s got two daughters and one son.
sentences.chinese: 她有两个女儿和一个儿子。

sentences.english: our eldest daughter
sentences.chinese: 我们的长女

detailed_translations.english: someone’s female child

sentences.english: We spent three days in Paris.
sentences.chinese: 我们在巴黎度过了三天。

sentences.english: She only leaves her house during the day.
sentences.chinese: 她只在白天出门。

sentences.english: It was a cold blustery day.
sentences.chinese: 那是个寒风呼啸的冷天。

sentences.english: Kept in that dark cell, I could no longer tell whether it was day or night.
sentences.chinese: 我被关在那个漆黑的牢房里，不知是白天还是黑夜。

sentences.english: The day dawned (= started ) bright and clear.
sentences.chinese: 拂晓时天朗气清。

detailed_translations.english: a period of 24 hours

name: dead
trans: 无生命的；呆板的；废弃了的

sentences.english: Her mother had been dead for ten years.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲去世十年了。

sentences.english: Police are trying to contact the family of the dead man.
sentences.chinese: 警方在设法与死者的家属联系。

sentences.english: a pile of dead leaves
sentences.chinese: 一堆枯叶

sentences.english: the dead body of a young soldier
sentences.chinese: 一名年轻士兵的尸体

sentences.english: Two men were shot dead by terrorists.
sentences.chinese: 两名男子遭恐怖分子枪杀。

sentences.english: Magnus was found dead in his car.
sentences.chinese: 马格纳斯被人发现死在他自己的车里。

sentences.english: One man is still missing, presumed dead .
sentences.chinese: 仍有一人失踪，被推定已经死亡。

sentences.english: He suddenly had a heart attack and dropped dead .
sentences.chinese: 他突发心脏病猝死。

sentences.english: She was pronounced dead on arrival at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 到达医院时她被宣告已经死亡。

sentences.english: His fellow climbers had left him for dead on the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 他的登山伙伴以为他已死，便把他留在山上走了。

sentences.english: We didn’t know if she was dead or alive.
sentences.chinese: 我们不知道她是死是活。

sentences.english: When they found him he was more dead than alive .
sentences.chinese: 他们发现他的时候，他已奄奄一息。

sentences.english: Her parents were long dead .
sentences.chinese: 她父母早就去世了。

detailed_translations.english: no longer alive

name: deal
trans: 处理，给予；做买卖，经营；协议，交易

sentences.english: The prime minister promised farmers a new deal (= a new and fairer system ) .
sentences.chinese: 首相向农民保证推行一项新政策。

detailed_translations.english: treatment of a particular type that is given or received

sentences.english: Dear Sir or Madam, ...
sentences.chinese: 尊敬的先生或女士，…

sentences.english: Dear Mrs. Wilson, ...
sentences.chinese: 尊敬的威尔逊夫人，…

sentences.english: Dear Meg, ...
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的梅格，…

sentences.english: You're a lot like me, dear.
sentences.chinese: 你和我太像了，亲爱的。

detailed_translations.english: used before someone’s name or title to begin a letter
You can call someone dear as a sign of affection

sentences.english: 1.5 million people are in immediate danger of death from starvation.
sentences.chinese: 150万人正因饥饿而即将面临死亡的危险。

detailed_translations.english: a creature that looks like a human  skeleton  , used in paintings, stories etc to represent the fact that people die

sentences.english: ...the last decade of the nineteenth century.
sentences.chinese: …19世纪的最后10年。

detailed_translations.english: a period of 10 years

sentences.english: In the dark of December.
sentences.chinese: 在十二月的黑夜里。

sentences.english: Our summers are short and our winters long.In December, when it is darkest, we only have a few hours of very weak sunlight per day.
sentences.chinese: 我们的夏天很短但是冬天很长，在十二月，也就是最黑的时候，我们的一天中只有很短的时间可以看到微弱的阳光。

sentences.english: I send out Valentine’s cards with the girls’ photo, instead of trying to mail cards in December.
sentences.chinese: ——我寄出有女孩子照片的情人节贺卡，以代替试图在十二月寄出的贺卡。

detailed_translations.english: the 12th month of the year, between November and January

name: decent
trans: 正派的；得体的；相当好的

sentences.english: a decent burial
sentences.chinese: 得体的葬礼

sentences.english: Paul visited the local bars more frequently than was decent for a senior lecturer.
sentences.chinese: 保罗过于频繁地光顾当地酒吧，不太合乎高级讲师的身份。

sentences.english: The chairman did the decent thing (= did what people thought he ought to ) and resigned.
sentences.chinese: 主席体面地辞去了职务。

detailed_translations.english: following moral standards that are acceptable to society

sentences.english: Has anything been decided yet?
sentences.chinese: 已经作出什么决定了吗？

sentences.english: The trainees decide among themselves what programs to take.
sentences.chinese: 受训者自行选择课程。

sentences.english: After a long discussion, they decided in favour of (= chose ) the older applicant.
sentences.chinese: 经过长时间的讨论，他们决定选那位较年长的求职者。

detailed_translations.english: to make a choice or judgment about something, especially after considering all the possibilities or arguments

sentences.english: Do you ever wonder if you made the right decision?
sentences.chinese: 你怀疑过自己所作的决定是否正确吗？

sentences.english: The judges’ decision is final (= it will not be changed ).
sentences.chinese: 法官的裁决是最终判决。

sentences.english: the ability to act with speed and decision
sentences.chinese: 处事迅速果断的能力

detailed_translations.english: a choice or judgment that you make after a period of discussion or thought

sentences.english: A state of emergency has been declared.
sentences.chinese: 已宣布进入紧急状态。

sentences.english: Mr Steel has been declared bankrupt
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂尔先生被宣布破产了。

sentences.english: We celebrate September 16, the day when Mexico declared independence from Spain (= officially stated that it was no longer ruled by Spain ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们在9月16日举行庆祝活动，这一天是墨西哥摆脱西班牙统治宣布独立的日子。

detailed_translations.english: to state officially and publicly that a particular situation exists or that something is true

name: decline
trans: 下降，减少；衰退，衰落；倾斜

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

sentences.english: The bathroom is decorated in green and yellow.
sentences.chinese: 浴室里是用绿色和黄色装潢的。

sentences.english: We plan to spend the weekend decorating.
sentences.chinese: 我们计划用这个周末来装修。

detailed_translations.english: to paint the inside of a room, put special paper on the walls etc

sentences.english: Christmas decorations
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节装饰物

sentences.english: cake decorations
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕上的裱花

detailed_translations.english: something pretty that you put in a place or on top of something to make it look attractive

sentences.english: The number of people who have the disease has decreased significantly in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，这种病的患者人数明显下降。

sentences.english: They want to decrease their reliance on oil.
sentences.chinese: 他们想减少对石油的依赖。

sentences.english: There has been a steady decrease of temperature.
sentences.chinese: 气温在持续下降。

detailed_translations.english: to become less or go down to a lower level, or to make something do this
the process of becoming less, or the amount by which something becomes less

sentences.english: a deep narrow valley
sentences.chinese: 又深又窄的山谷

sentences.english: a deep wound
sentences.chinese: 很深的伤口

sentences.english: She was sitting in a deep leather chair.
sentences.chinese: 她坐在一张很深的皮椅子里。

detailed_translations.english: going far down from the top or from the surface

sentences.english: Her lies hurt my father deeply.
sentences.chinese: 她的谎言深深地伤害了我父亲。

detailed_translations.english: a long way into something

sentences.english: They hoped to defeat the enemy at sea.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望在海上击败敌人。

sentences.english: She was a woman who hated to admit defeat.
sentences.chinese: 她是个不愿认输的女人。

detailed_translations.english: to win a victory over someone in a war, competition, game etc
failure to win or succeed

sentences.english: soldiers who died in defence of their country
sentences.chinese: 为保卫祖国而献身的战士

sentences.english: The harbour's sea defences are in poor condition.
sentences.chinese: 港口的海防工事状况很差。

sentences.english: He wanted to conduct his own defence.
sentences.chinese: 他想自己为自己辩护。

detailed_translations.english: the act of protecting sb/sth from attack, criticism, etc.

name: defend
trans: 防御，防卫，保卫；为...辩护，为...答辩

sentences.english: She was always defending her husband in front of their daughter.
sentences.chinese: 她在女儿面前总是为丈夫辩解。

sentences.english: Students should be ready to explain and defend their views.
sentences.chinese: 学生应该勇于为自己的观点进行解释和辩护。

detailed_translations.english: to use arguments to protect something or someone from criticism, or to prove that something is right

name: define
trans: 规定，限定；使明确，使清楚；解释，下定义

sentences.english: the ability to define clients’ needs
sentences.chinese: 确定客户需求的能力

sentences.english: The duties of the post are difficult to define.
sentences.chinese: 这一职位的职责很难界定。

sentences.english: Define precisely what you mean by ‘crime’.
sentences.chinese: 把你说的 “犯罪” 明确定义一下。

detailed_translations.english: to describe something correctly and thoroughly, and to say what standards, limits, qualities etc it has that make it different from other things

sentences.english: It’s impossible for me to give you a definite answer.
sentences.chinese: 我不可能给你明确的答复。

sentences.english: We need to record sufficient data to enable definite conclusions to be reached.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要记录足够的数据，才能得出明确的结论。

sentences.english: He’d shown definite signs of resigning himself to the situation.
sentences.chinese: 他明显表现出安于这种状况的样子。

sentences.english: Fix a definite date for the delivery of your computer.
sentences.chinese: 请为你的电脑定个确切的交货日期。

detailed_translations.english: clearly known, seen, or stated

sentences.english: ‘Do you reckon Margot will be there?’ ‘ Definitely not .’
sentences.chinese: “你估计玛戈会在那里吗？” “肯定不会。”

sentences.english: The hotel fitness centre is definitely worth a visit.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店的健身中心绝对值得一去。

sentences.english: I definitely need a holiday.
sentences.chinese: 我太需要休假了。

detailed_translations.english: without any doubt

sentences.english: a dictionary definition
sentences.chinese: 词典里的释义

detailed_translations.english: a phrase or sentence that says exactly what a word, phrase, or idea means

sentences.english: Newspapers vary in the degree to which they emphasize propaganda rather than information.
sentences.chinese: 报纸重宣传轻资讯的程度各不相同。

detailed_translations.english: the level or amount of something

sentences.english: Don’t delay – send off for the information now.
sentences.chinese: 别犹豫——即刻去函索取信息。

sentences.english: He delayed his decision on whether to call an election.
sentences.chinese: 在是否宣布举行选举一事上，他推迟作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to wait until a later time to do something

name: deliberate
trans: 故意的， 蓄意的； 慎重的， 深思熟虑的

sentences.english: a deliberate attempt to humiliate her
sentences.chinese: 对她的故意羞辱

sentences.english: The attack on him was quite deliberate.
sentences.chinese: 对他的袭击完全是有预谋的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 故意的， 蓄意的； 慎重的， 深思熟虑的
detailed_translations.english: intended or planned
to think about something very carefully

name: deliberately
trans: adv. 故意地；谨慎地；慎重地

sentences.english: He deliberately upset her.
sentences.chinese: 他故意惹她不开心。

sentences.english: He shook his head slowly and deliberately.
sentences.chinese: 他缓缓而慎重地摇摇头。

detailed_translations.english: done in a way that is intended or planned

name: delicious
trans: 美味的； 芬芳的， 怡人的； 有趣的

sentences.english: ‘The meal was absolutely delicious,’ she said politely.
sentences.chinese: “这顿饭味道好极了。” 她礼貌地说道。

sentences.english: the delicious smell of new-mown grass
sentences.chinese: 新修剪的草坪的芳香

detailed_translations.english: very pleasant to taste or smell

sentences.english: The kids were screaming with delight.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在高兴地尖叫。

sentences.english: He is delighting audiences with his wit and humour.
sentences.chinese: 他在用自己的智慧和幽默娱乐观众。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great pleasure and satisfaction
to give someone great satisfaction and enjoyment

sentences.english: Her screams of delighted laughter filled the air.
sentences.chinese: 她喜悦的尖叫声在空中荡漾。

detailed_translations.english: very pleased and happy

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…兴高采烈；感到快乐（delight的过去分词）

name: deliver
trans: 投递，传送；发表，宣布；给予；发射

sentences.english: The morning mail has just been delivered.
sentences.chinese: 早晨的邮件刚送到。

sentences.english: Do you deliver on Saturdays?
sentences.chinese: 星期六你们送货吗？

sentences.english: I’m having some flowers delivered for her birthday.
sentences.chinese: 我在安排人给她送花祝贺生日。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, letters, packages etc to a particular place or person

sentences.english: Most Indian restaurants offer free delivery.
sentences.chinese: 大多数印度餐馆提供免费外送服务。

sentences.english: You can expect delivery in a week to ten days.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在一周至十天内收到货物。

sentences.english: fresh milk deliveries
sentences.chinese: 新鲜牛奶递送

sentences.english: Mrs Howell had an easy delivery.
sentences.chinese: 豪厄尔太太的分娩很顺利。

detailed_translations.english: the act of bringing goods, letters etc to a particular person or place, or the things that are brought

sentences.english: Angry demonstrators demanded the resignation of two senior officials.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的示威者要求两名高级官员辞职。

sentences.english: ‘Where are you going?’ she demanded angrily.
sentences.chinese: “你要去哪里？” 她气愤地质问道。

detailed_translations.english: to ask for something very firmly, especially because you think you have a right to do this
the need or desire that people have for particular goods and services

name: demonstrate
trans: 论证，证明；示范，宣传；游行，示威

sentences.english: The study demonstrates the link between poverty and malnutrition.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究证明了贫困与营养不良之间的联系。

sentences.english: The government now has an opportunity to demonstrate its commitment to reform.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在有机会表明改革的决心了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明， 论证； 表露
detailed_translations.english: to show or prove something clearly

sentences.english: Visit your dentist twice a year for a checkup.
sentences.chinese: 每年看两次牙医做检查。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to treat people’s teeth

sentences.english: The government denied the existence of poverty among 16- and 17-year-olds.
sentences.chinese: 政府否认十六七岁的青少年当中存在贫困问题。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or that you do not believe something

sentences.english: the personnel department
sentences.chinese: 人事部

sentences.english: the English department
sentences.chinese: 英语系

detailed_translations.english: one of the groups of people who work together in a particular part of a large organization such as a hospital, university, company, or government

sentences.english: There are several departures for New York every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天有好几个班次去纽约。

detailed_translations.english: an act of leaving a place, especially at the start of a journey

sentences.english: He depended on his writing for his income.
sentences.chinese: 他靠写作谋生。

sentences.english: You can depend on Jane – she always keeps her promises.
sentences.chinese: 你可以相信简——她一向都信守诺言。

detailed_translations.english: to need the support, help, or existence of someone or something in order to exist, be healthy, be successful etc

sentences.english: Britain’s depressed housing market
sentences.chinese: 英国不景气的房产市场

sentences.english: She felt lonely and depressed .
sentences.chinese: 她感到孤独和沮丧。

detailed_translations.english: an area, industry etc that is depressed does not have enough economic or business activity

name: depressing
trans: adj. 压抑的；使人沮丧的

sentences.english: It’s a depressing thought.
sentences.chinese: 这是个令人沮丧的想法。

sentences.english: The whole experience was very depressing.
sentences.chinese: 整个经历非常令人沮丧。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel very sad

sentences.english: What's the depth of the water here?
sentences.chinese: 这儿的水有多深？

sentences.english: the depth of her love
sentences.chinese: 她那爱之深

sentences.english: Astronomers may one day travel to the depths of space.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家也许有一天可以到太空深处去。

detailed_translations.english: the distance from the top or surface to the bottom of sth

sentences.english: The police asked her to describe the man.
sentences.chinese: 警察叫她描述一下那名男子。

sentences.english: Another approach to the problem is described in Chapter 3.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题的另一种解决方法在第三章有所阐述。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形容， 描写； 画出
detailed_translations.english: to say what something or someone is like by giving details about them

sentences.english: The booklet gives a brief description of each place.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子对每一个地方都作了简短的介绍。

sentences.english: Berlin sounds fascinating from your description.
sentences.chinese: 从你的描述来看，柏林是个迷人的城市。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing or speech that gives details about what someone or something is like

sentences.english: the Sahara Desert
sentences.chinese: 撒哈拉沙漠

sentences.english: This area of the country is mostly desert.
sentences.chinese: 该国的这一地区大部分是沙漠。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of land where it is always very dry, and there is a lot of sand
to leave someone or something and no longer help or support them

sentences.english: What have I done to deserve this?
sentences.chinese: 我做了什么事，要得到这样的报应？

sentences.english: I’m sorry for the kids. They deserve better (= deserve to be treated in a better way ) .
sentences.chinese: 我为这些孩子感到难过，他们应该过得更好。

sentences.english: Ledley deserves a place in the team.
sentences.chinese: 莱德利应该在队里占有一席之地。

sentences.english: Paula deserves a special mention for all the help she has given us.
sentences.chinese: 应该特别提一下葆拉，她给了我们许多帮助。

sentences.english: I would never hit anyone, even if they deserved it.
sentences.chinese: 我决不会打人，哪怕他欠揍。

sentences.english: What has he done to deserve this punishment ?
sentences.chinese: 他做了什么，竟会受到这样的惩罚？

sentences.english: People who are sent to prison for drunk-driving get what they deserve .
sentences.chinese: 那些醉酒驾车被送进监狱的人是罪有应得的。

detailed_translations.english: to have earned something by good or bad actions or behaviour

sentences.english: The tower was designed by Gilbert Scott.
sentences.chinese: 这座塔楼是吉尔伯特·斯科特设计的。

detailed_translations.english: to make a drawing or plan of something that will be made or built

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计， 构想； 图样； 企图
detailed_translations.english: the art or process of making a drawing of something to show how you will make it or what it will look like

name: designer
trans: adj. 由设计师专门设计的；享有盛名的；赶时髦的

sentences.english: an interior designer
sentences.chinese: 室内装潢设计师

sentences.english: a software designer
sentences.chinese: 软件设计师

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make plans or patterns for clothes, furniture, equipment etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 由设计师专门设计的；享有盛名的；赶时髦的
detailed_translations.english: made by a well-known and fashionable designer

name: desire
trans: 希望，渴望；愿望，欲望，要求

sentences.english: The hotel has everything you could possibly desire .
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店里你想要的东西应有尽有。

sentences.english: Add lemon juice if desired .
sentences.chinese: 需要的话加点柠檬汁。

detailed_translations.english: to want something very much
a strong hope or wish

sentences.english: Marie was sitting at her desk.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽正坐在书桌前。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture like a table, usually with drawers in it, that you sit at to write and work

sentences.chinese: 我身无分文，已经走投无路了。

sentences.english: Time was running out and we were getting desperate .
sentences.chinese: 时间越来越少，我们越来越感到绝望。

sentences.english: the missing teenager’s desperate parents
sentences.chinese: 失踪少年绝望的父母

detailed_translations.english: willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger

sentences.english: Despite all our efforts to save the school, the authorities decided to close it.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我们竭力想保住这所学校，当局还是决定把它关闭。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something happens or is true even though something else might have prevented it

sentences.english: Ellis Island has become one of America's most popular tourist destinations.
sentences.chinese: 埃利斯岛已经成为美国最受欢迎的游览地之一。

detailed_translations.english: the place that someone or something is going to

sentences.english: companies that are polluting and destroying the environment
sentences.chinese: 污染和破坏环境的公司

detailed_translations.english: to damage something so badly that it no longer exists or cannot be used or repaired

sentences.english: This issue will be discussed in more detail in Chapter 5.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在第五章里作更为详细的论述。

detailed_translations.english: a single feature, fact, or piece of information about something
to list things or give all the facts or information about something

name: detailed
trans: adj. 详细的，精细的；复杂的，详尽的
v. 详细说明（detail的过去分词）

sentences.english: a beautifully detailed carving
sentences.chinese: 漂亮精致的雕刻

detailed_translations.english: containing or including a lot of information or details

name: detect
trans: 查明，测出，发现，察觉；当场发现某人在干坏事

sentences.english: Many forms of cancer can be cured if detected early.
sentences.chinese: 如果发现得早，许多种癌症都可以治愈。

sentences.english: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
sentences.chinese: …一台探测辐射的敏感仪器。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

sentences.english: She hired a detective to find out if her husband was having an affair.
sentences.chinese: 她雇了一个私人侦探调查她丈夫是否有外遇。

detailed_translations.english: a police officer whose job is to discover information about crimes and catch criminals

sentences.english: Investigators are still trying to determine the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 调查人员仍在设法弄清失火的原因。

detailed_translations.english: to find out the facts about something

name: determined
trans: 下定决心的, 毅然的, 坚决的

sentences.english: Gwen is a very determined woman.
sentences.chinese: 格温是个意志很坚定的女性。

detailed_translations.english: having a strong desire to do something, so that you will not let anyone stop you

sentences.english: Knowledge in the field of genetics has been developing very rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 遗传学领域的知识发展非常迅速。

sentences.english: Corsica has developed its economy around the tourist industry.
sentences.chinese: 科西嘉岛的经济是围绕旅游业发展起来的。

sentences.english: exercises to develop muscle strength
sentences.chinese: 锻炼肌肉力量的运动

sentences.english: He had developed a certain affection for me.
sentences.chinese: 他对我产生了一些好感。

sentences.english: The land was developed for low-cost housing.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地被开发建造廉价住宅。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually grow or become bigger, more advanced, stronger, etc.; to make sth do this

name: development
trans: 发展；开发；发育；住宅小区（专指由同一开发商开发的）；[摄] 显影

sentences.english: child development
sentences.chinese: 儿童发育

sentences.english: The funds will be used for marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 这笔资金将用于市场营销和产品开发。

detailed_translations.english: the process of gradually becoming bigger, better, stronger, or more advanced

sentences.english: modern labour-saving devices
sentences.chinese: 省力的现代设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械， 装置； 设计； 手段， 策略
detailed_translations.english: a machine or tool that does a special job

sentences.english: This diagram will illustrate what I mean.
sentences.chinese: 这个图表可说明我的意思。

sentences.english: This is a simpler diagram than the one I just showed you but the principles are the same.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个比我刚展示的还要更简单的图解，但是原理是一样的。

sentences.english: A table or diagram containing the name and address range of each peripheral addressable by the processor within the memory space.
sentences.chinese: 一个在内存空间中的，包含每个外设的名字和可由处理器设置的地址范围的表格或图表。

detailed_translations.english: to show or represent something in a diagram

detailed_translations.chinese: 图解， 简图， 图表
detailed_translations.english: a simple drawing or plan that shows exactly where something is, what something looks like, or how something works

sentences.english: a boring movie full of bad dialog
sentences.chinese: 充满差劲对白的乏味电影

sentences.english: Students were asked to read simple dialogues out loud.
sentences.chinese: 学生被要求大声朗读简单的对话。

detailed_translations.english: a conversation in a book, play, or film

name: diamond
trans: n. 钻石，金刚石；菱形；方块牌

sentences.english: a diamond engagement ring
sentences.chinese: 订婚钻戒

detailed_translations.chinese: 钻石，金刚石；菱形；方块牌
detailed_translations.english: a clear, very hard valuable stone, used in jewellery and in industry

sentences.english: Inge kept a diary (= wrote in a diary ) during the war years.
sentences.chinese: 英奇在战争年代里一直写日记。

detailed_translations.english: a book in which you write down the things that happen to you each day

sentences.english: a German-English dictionary
sentences.chinese: 一本德英词典

detailed_translations.english: a book that gives a list of words in alphabetical order and explains their meanings in the same language, or another language

sentences.english: He died in 1985 at the age of 76.
sentences.chinese: 他1985年去世，终年76岁。

sentences.english: Her father died suddenly in an accident when she was only ten.
sentences.chinese: 她年仅10岁时父亲突然死于一场意外事故。

sentences.english: She died peacefully in her sleep at the age of 98.
sentences.chinese: 她在睡眠中安然辞世，享年98岁。

sentences.english: The bullet went straight through his head, and he died instantly.
sentences.chinese: 子弹穿过他的头部，他当场死亡。

sentences.english: Our love will never die.
sentences.chinese: 我们的爱始终不渝。

detailed_translations.english: to stop living and become dead

sentences.english: She doesn’t eat a very healthy diet.
sentences.chinese: 她的饮食不是很健康。

sentences.english: It is important to have a balanced diet.
sentences.chinese: 饮食均衡很重要。

sentences.english: Rice is the staple diet (= the main food that a group of people usually eat ) .
sentences.chinese: 大米是主食。

detailed_translations.english: the kind of food that a person or animal eats each day

sentences.english: There’s a big difference between knowing that something is true, and being able to prove it.
sentences.chinese: 知道什么正确与能够证明它正确，这之间有很大的不同。

sentences.english: There's not much difference in price between the two computers.
sentences.chinese: 这两种计算机价格上没有多大的差别。

sentences.english: We have our differences , but she's still my sister.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间虽然不和，但她仍旧是我的妹妹。

detailed_translations.english: a way in which two or more people or things are not like each other

name: different
trans: 不同的；个别的，与众不同的

sentences.english: The place looks completely different now.
sentences.chinese: 这地方现在完全变了。

sentences.english: They decided to try a radically different approach.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定尝试一种全然不同的办法。

sentences.english: We found women had significantly different political views from men.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现女性的政治观点与男性大不相同。

sentences.english: a slightly different way of doing things
sentences.chinese: 稍有区别的做事方法

sentences.english: What actually happened was subtly different from the PR people’s version.
sentences.chinese: 实际情况与公关部那些人的说法有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The show is refreshingly different from most exhibitions of modern art.
sentences.chinese: 这次展览与大多数现代艺术展不一样，令人耳目一新。

sentences.english: The publishing business is no different from any other business in this respect.
sentences.chinese: 从这一点来讲，出版业和其他任何行业没有什么差别。

sentences.english: It’s a different world here in London.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦这儿的情况完全不同。

detailed_translations.english: not like something or someone else, or not like before

sentences.english: Words written alike are often pronounced differently.
sentences.chinese: 拼法相同的词往往读音不同。

sentences.english: Different lawyers may construe the same law differently.
sentences.chinese: 对同一法律，不同的律师可以做出不同的解释。

sentences.english: For me, this uncertainty lies at the heart of what we need to know if we are to understand ourselves and behave differently.
sentences.chinese: 对我而言，这样的不确定性就存在于我们需要去了解的内心，即我们懂得我们自己和行为本身是不同的。

name: difficult
trans: 困难的；不随和的；执拗的

sentences.english: a difficult question
sentences.chinese: 难解的问题

sentences.english: an immensely difficult task
sentences.chinese: 极为艰巨的任务

sentences.english: Was the exam very difficult?
sentences.chinese: 这次考试很难吗？

sentences.english: It’s difficult to see how more savings can be made.
sentences.chinese: 想要进一步节约看来是很难了。

sentences.english: Don’t be so difficult!
sentences.chinese: 别这么挑剔！

detailed_translations.english: hard to do, understand, or deal with

sentences.english: They had great difficulty in finding a replacement.
sentences.chinese: 他们找接替的人费了很大劲

sentences.english: If you have any difficulties, give me a call.
sentences.chinese: 如果你遇到困难，就给我打电话。

sentences.english: She soon got into difficulty with debt.
sentences.chinese: 她很快就因债务陷入了困境。

detailed_translations.english: if you have difficulty doing something, it is difficult for you to do

sentences.english: Dig down about 6 inches.
sentences.chinese: 往下挖大约六英寸深。

detailed_translations.english: to move earth, snow etc, or to make a hole in the ground, using a spade or your hands

sentences.english: digital TV
sentences.chinese: 数字电视

sentences.english: a digital signal
sentences.chinese: 数字信号

sentences.english: a digital camera
sentences.chinese: 数码照相机

sentences.english: digital recording
sentences.chinese: 数字录音

detailed_translations.english: using a system in which information is recorded or sent out electronically in the form of numbers, usually ones and zeros

sentences.english: What time do you usually have dinner?
sentences.chinese: 你通常什么时候吃饭？

sentences.english: We’re having fish for dinner tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天晚饭吃鱼。

sentences.english: What’s for dinner?
sentences.chinese: 晚饭吃什么？

sentences.english: the Club’s annual dinner
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的年度晚宴

detailed_translations.english: the main meal of the day, eaten in the middle of the day or the evening

name: direct
trans: 直接的；直系的；亲身的；恰好的
直接地；正好；按直系关系

sentences.english: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
sentences.chinese: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。

sentences.english: I’m not in direct contact with them.
sentences.chinese: 我和他们没有直接的联系。

sentences.english: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
sentences.chinese: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

sentences.english: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
sentences.chinese: 女人常常觉得男人太直率，不够体贴。

detailed_translations.english: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between

name: direction
trans: 方向；指导；趋势；用法说明

sentences.english: Which direction did they go in ?
sentences.chinese: 他们朝哪个方向走了？

sentences.english: A very helpful woman gave me directions to the police station.
sentences.chinese: 一个很热心的妇女给我指了去警察局的路。

sentences.english: Be sure you read the directions before using any piece of equipment.
sentences.chinese: 使用任何设备之前一定要先阅读操作指南。

detailed_translations.english: the way something or someone moves, faces, or is aimed

name: directly
trans: 直接地； 正好地， 截然； 立即

sentences.english: The new property tax law won’t directly affect us.
sentences.chinese: 新的财产税法不会直接影响到我们。

sentences.english: We hope to bring together the countries directly involved in the conflict.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望让直接卷入冲突的各国重归于好。

sentences.english: Most guests left directly after the wake.
sentences.chinese: 守灵仪式一结束，大部分客人就立刻走了。

detailed_translations.english: with no other person, action, process etc between

name: director
trans: 主任，主管；导演；人事助理

sentences.english: The company is run by a board of directors (= a group of directors ) .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司由董事会管理。

sentences.english: the director of education
sentences.chinese: 教育局局长

detailed_translations.chinese: 理事；导演；指导者；负责人
detailed_translations.english: someone who controls or manages a company

name: dirt
trans: 污垢，泥土；灰尘，尘土；下流话

sentences.english: You should have seen the dirt on that car!
sentences.chinese: 你没看见那车上沾了多少泥！

sentences.english: His face and hands were black with dirt.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸和手黑乎乎的，全是泥。

sentences.english: Michael threw his handful of dirt onto the coffin.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔往棺材上撒了一把土。

detailed_translations.english: any substance that makes things dirty, such as mud or dust

name: dirty
trans: 下流的，卑鄙的；肮脏的；恶劣的；暗淡的

sentences.english: a stack of dirty dishes in the sink
sentences.chinese: 洗涤槽里的一堆脏碟子

sentences.english: How did you get so dirty?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会弄得这么脏？

sentences.english: kids telling dirty jokes
sentences.chinese: 讲着下流笑话的年轻人

sentences.english: a dirty magazine
sentences.chinese: 色情杂志

detailed_translations.english: covered in or marked by an unwanted substance

name: disadvantage
trans: n. 缺点；不利条件；损失

sentences.english: Criminal behaviour can be linked to economic disadvantage.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪行为可能会与经济困难有关。

detailed_translations.english: something that causes problems, or that makes someone or something less likely to be successful or effective

name: disagree
trans: vi. 意见不一致，持不同意见

sentences.english: Barr strongly disagreed with Kronfeld’s statement.
sentences.chinese: 巴尔强烈反对克龙费尔德的说法。

sentences.english: The statements of several witnesses disagree.
sentences.chinese: 几名证人的证词不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to have or express a different opinion from someone else

sentences.english: At this point the path seemed to disappear altogether (= disappear completely ) .
sentences.chinese: 小路到这里好像完全消失了。

sentences.english: The two girls disappeared while walking home from school..
sentences.chinese: 这两名女孩在放学回家的路上失踪了。

detailed_translations.english: to become impossible to see any longer

name: disappointed
trans: adj. 失望的，沮丧的；受挫折的

sentences.english: Dad seemed more disappointed than angry.
sentences.chinese: 与其说爸爸生气，倒不如说他失望。

sentences.english: disappointed customers
sentences.chinese: 失望的顾客

detailed_translations.chinese: 失望的，沮丧的；受挫折的
detailed_translations.english: unhappy because something you hoped for did not happen, or because someone or something was not as good as you expected

name: disappointing
trans: adj.令人失望的；令人扫兴的v.令人失望（disappoint的ing形式）；辜负…的期望

sentences.english: The fire was caused by an electrical fault.
sentences.chinese: 大火是电力故障引起的。

sentences.english: an electrical engineer
sentences.chinese: 电力[电气]工程师

detailed_translations.english: relating to electricity

name: electricity
trans: 电； 电学； 电力供应， 电流

sentences.english: The farm was very isolated, but it had electricity.
sentences.chinese: 那个农场非常偏远，但有电力供应。

detailed_translations.english: the power that is carried by wires, cables etc, and is used to provide light or heat, to make machines work etc

sentences.english: electronic games
sentences.chinese: 电子游戏

sentences.english: an electronic organizer (= a small piece of electronic equipment that you can use to record addresses, phone numbers etc )
sentences.chinese: 电子记事本

detailed_translations.english: electronic equipment, such as computers and televisions, uses electricity that has passed through computer chips, transistors etc

name: element
trans: 元素；要素，组成部分，基本部分

sentences.english: Business and management elements are built into the course.
sentences.chinese: 本课程加入了商务和管理方面的内容。

sentences.english: Hydrogen is a one-valence element.
sentences.chinese: 氢是一价的元素。

detailed_translations.english: one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important

sentences.english: A trunk distinguishes the elephant.
sentences.chinese: 长鼻是象的特征。

sentences.english: So the part of the elephant I experience applies what we know about people and how we apply that to UX design.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我体验的那部分的大象就是我们对人的了解和我们将我们的了解应用于用户体验设计。

sentences.english: Tom: No.Although 75% of its raw materials is elephant dung, it is light delicate fragrance instead of stink. This is due to its special fabrication technology.
sentences.chinese: 不，尽管这种纸里75％的原料都是大象的粪便，但它不但不臭，反而有一种淡淡的清香，这是源于它的特殊的制造工艺。

detailed_translations.english: a very large grey animal with four legs, two tusks(= long curved teeth ) and a trunk(= long nose ) that it can use to pick things up

sentences.english: She was sent to jail for eleven months.
sentences.chinese: 她被判入狱11个月。

sentences.english: I never go to bed before eleven (= 11 o’clock ).
sentences.chinese: 我从不在11点钟以前上床睡觉。

sentences.english: James had worked every summer since he was eleven (= 11 years old ).
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯自11岁起每年夏天都打工。

detailed_translations.english: the number
the number

name: else
trans: (Else)人名；(英)埃尔斯；(德)埃尔泽；(芬、丹)埃尔塞

sentences.english: There’s something else I’d like to talk about as well.
sentences.chinese: 我还有其他事情要谈一谈。

sentences.english: I’d like you to come, and anyone else who’s free.
sentences.chinese: 我想请你过来，其他人有空也可以来。

sentences.english: He was awake now, as was everyone else.
sentences.chinese: 他现在已经醒了，其他人也都醒了。

sentences.english: Who else was at the party?
sentences.chinese: 还有谁参加了聚会？

sentences.english: ‘Two coffees, please.’ ‘Anything else?’ ‘No, thanks.’
sentences.chinese: “请来两杯咖啡。”“还要别的吗？”“不要了，谢谢。

sentences.english: (= more than any other things ) she was seeking love.
sentences.chinese: 她追求爱情胜过一切。

sentences.english: If I can't make a living at painting, at least I can teach someone else to paint.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不能以画画谋生的话，至少我能教别人画画。

sentences.english: We had nothing else to do on those long trips.
sentences.chinese: 在那些漫长的旅途中我们别无他事可做。

detailed_translations.english: besides or in addition to someone or something
You use else after words such as "anywhere," "someone," and "what" to refer in a vague way to another person, place, or thing

sentences.english: She is becoming famous in Australia and elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 她在澳大利亚和其他地方渐渐出名了。

sentences.english: Kerala has less crime and alcoholism than elsewhere in India.
sentences.chinese: 喀拉拉邦的犯罪和酗酒现象少于印度的其他地区。

detailed_translations.english: in, at, or to another place

sentences.english: It’s usually best to contact him by email.
sentences.chinese: 一般最好是用电子邮件和他联络。

detailed_translations.english: a system that allows you to send and receive messages by computer

name: embarrassed
trans: 使困窘；使局促不安（embarrass的过去分词形式）

sentences.english: Lori gets embarrassed if we ask her to sing.
sentences.chinese: 我们要是请洛丽唱歌，她就会难为情。

sentences.english: He looked embarrassed when I asked him where he’d been.
sentences.chinese: 我问他去了哪里，他显得很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: feeling uncomfortable or nervous and worrying about what people think of you, for example because you have made a silly mistake, or because you have to talk or sing in public

sentences.english: She asked a lot of embarrassing questions.
sentences.chinese: 她问了许多令人尴尬的问题。

sentences.english: an embarrassing situation
sentences.chinese: 令人难堪的处境

detailed_translations.chinese: 使人尴尬的；令人为难的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable

sentences.english: The flowers emerge in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 花儿在春天开放。

sentences.english: After the elections opposition groups began to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 经过选举，反对派开始露头。

detailed_translations.english: to appear or come out from somewhere

name: emergency
trans: 紧急情况，突然事件，非常时刻

sentences.english: Lifeguards are trained to deal with emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 救生员接受过应对紧急情况的训练。

sentences.english: (= In case of emergency ), press the alarm button.
sentences.chinese: 遇到紧急情况，请按报警按钮。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机不得不紧急着陆。

sentences.english: The government called an emergency meeting to discuss the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 政府召开了紧急会议，讨论这次危机。

detailed_translations.english: an unexpected and dangerous situation that must be dealt with immediately

sentences.english: Her voice was full of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音充满了激情。

sentences.english: She was good at hiding her emotions.
sentences.chinese: 她很会掩饰自己的情感。

sentences.english: Kim received the news without showing any visible sign of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 金接到消息时丝毫不露声色。

detailed_translations.english: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger

sentences.english: She provided emotional support at a very distressing time for me.
sentences.chinese: 在我非常痛苦的时候，她是我的情感支柱。

sentences.english: Ann suffered from depression and a number of other emotional problems.
sentences.chinese: 安患了抑郁症，还遇到一些其他的情绪问题。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional state of the patient
sentences.chinese: 患者的生理和情绪状态

sentences.english: The funeral was a very emotional experience for all of us.
sentences.chinese: 那次葬礼对我们大家来说都是一次无比伤感的经历。

sentences.english: He became very emotional when we had to leave.
sentences.chinese: 当我们不得不离开时，他非常伤感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 情绪(上)的，情感(上)的；激起感情的； 敏感的；情绪激动的〔尤指哭泣〕
detailed_translations.english: relating to your feelings or how you control them

sentences.english: a change of emphasis in government policy
sentences.chinese: 政府政策重心的变化

detailed_translations.chinese: 强调； 重视； 重要性
detailed_translations.english: special attention or importance

sentences.english: The factory employs over 2,000 people.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

sentences.english: The report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 这个报告探讨了课堂教学方法。

sentences.english: Her days are employed in gardening and voluntary work.
sentences.chinese: 她的时间都花在搞园艺和做义工上。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone to work for you

sentences.english: a government employee
sentences.chinese: 政府雇员

detailed_translations.english: someone who is paid to work for someone else

sentences.english: The shoe factory is the largest employer in this area.
sentences.chinese: 这家制鞋厂是本地区最大的雇主。

detailed_translations.english: a person, company, or organization that employs people

sentences.english: She was offered employment in the sales office.
sentences.chinese: 她获聘在销售部工作。

sentences.english: terms and conditions of employment
sentences.chinese: 雇用条款和条件

sentences.english: Steve’s still looking for full-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫还在寻找全职工作。

sentences.english: the needs of women who combine paid employment and care for their families
sentences.chinese: 兼顾有薪工作和照料家庭的女性的需要

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作； 雇用； 使用
detailed_translations.english: the condition of having a paid job

name: empty
trans: 空的；无意义的；无知的；徒劳的

sentences.english: an empty box
sentences.chinese: 空盒子

sentences.english: an empty bottle
sentences.chinese: 空瓶子

sentences.english: an empty space behind the desk
sentences.chinese: 书桌后面的空位

sentences.english: The fuel tank’s almost empty.
sentences.chinese: 燃油箱快要空了。

detailed_translations.english: having nothing inside

sentences.english: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.
sentences.chinese: 新的检验使医生能在早期发现该种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it

name: encounter
trans: 冲突，交战；意外的遇见，遭遇

sentences.english: The doctor had encountered several similar cases in the past.
sentences.chinese: 那位医生过去曾碰到过好几个类似病例。

detailed_translations.english: to experience something, especially problems or opposition
an occasion when you meet someone, or do something with someone you do not know

name: encourage
trans: 鼓励，支持；发展，激励，促进

sentences.english: I want to thank everyone who has encouraged and supported me.
sentences.chinese: 我要感谢每一位鼓励和支持过我的人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the courage or confidence to do something

sentences.english: He wore spectacles perched on the very end of his nose.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼镜架在鼻尖上。

sentences.english: The end of the pencil snapped.
sentences.chinese: 铅笔的笔尖啪的一声断了。

sentences.english: Jo joined the end of the line.
sentences.chinese: 乔排到了队尾。

sentences.english: She’ll do anything to achieve her own ends.
sentences.chinese: 她为了实现自己的目标，什么都会去做。

sentences.english: The road ends here.
sentences.chinese: 这条路到此为止。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a place or object that is furthest from its beginning or centre
to finish; to make sth finish

sentences.english: a story with a happy ending
sentences.chinese: 结局美满的故事

detailed_translations.english: the way that a story, film, activity etc finishes

sentences.english: She’s a dangerous enemy to have.
sentences.chinese: 与她为敌很危险。

sentences.english: Cats and dogs have always been natural enemies.
sentences.chinese: 猫和狗向来是天敌。

sentences.english: an old enemy of her father
sentences.chinese: 她父亲的一个宿敌

sentences.english: the unforgettable sight of the president shaking hands with his sworn enemy
sentences.chinese: 董事长与其死敌握手的难忘情景

sentences.english: I wouldn’t wishthis on my worst enemy.
sentences.chinese: 即使是我的死对头，我也不愿看到他发生这样的事情。

detailed_translations.english: someone who hates you and wants to harm you

sentences.english: Where do those kids get their energy from?
sentences.chinese: 那些孩子哪来这么多精力？

sentences.english: I really put a lot of energy into what I do.
sentences.chinese: 我做起事来总是投入很大精力。

sentences.english: kinetic energy
sentences.chinese: 动能

detailed_translations.english: the physical and mental strength that makes you able to do things

name: engage
trans: 与...建立密切关系；尽力理解；吸引；占用时间、精力等

sentences.english: She engaged the clutch and the car moved.
sentences.chinese: 她踩下离合器，汽车便开动了。

sentences.english: The wheel engages with the cog and turns it.
sentences.chinese: 轮子咬住轮齿并带动它转动。

detailed_translations.english: if you engage part of a machine, or if it engages, it moves so that it fits into another part of the machine
a public toilet that is engaged is being used

detailed_translations.chinese: 保证；约定；同…订婚（engage的过去分词）

name: engine
trans: 引擎，发动机；机车，火车头；工具

sentences.english: Is the engine running smoothly?
sentences.chinese: 发动机运转平稳吗？

sentences.english: We were stranded with engine trouble on a deserted highway.
sentences.chinese: 我们因发动机故障而被困在空无一人的公路上。

sentences.english: In 1941, the train would have been pulled by a steam engine.
sentences.chinese: 1941年，火车可能已由蒸汽机车来牵引了。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a vehicle that produces power to make it move

name: engineer
trans: n. 工程师；工兵；火车司机
vt. 设计；策划；精明地处理

sentences.english: He trained as a civil engineer (= one who designs and builds roads, bridges etc ).
sentences.chinese: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design or build roads, bridges, machines etc

sentences.english: The bridge is a triumph of modern engineering.
sentences.chinese: 这座桥是现代工程的一大成就。

sentences.english: a degree in engineering
sentences.chinese: 工程学学位

detailed_translations.english: the activity of applying scientific knowledge to the design, building and control of machines, roads, bridges, electrical equipment, etc.

name: enhance
trans: 提高（价格、质量、吸引力等），增加，增强

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

name: enjoy
trans: 欣赏，享受；喜爱；使过得快活

sentences.english: We thoroughly enjoyed our time in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我们在纽约的时间过得十分快活。

sentences.english: Thanks for a great evening. I really enjoyed it.
sentences.chinese: 感谢你这美好的晚会。我真的玩得很开心。

detailed_translations.english: to get pleasure from something

name: enormous
trans: 庞大的，巨大的；凶暴的，极恶的

sentences.english: an enormous bunch of flowers
sentences.chinese: 巨大的花束

sentences.english: an enormous amount of money
sentences.chinese: 巨款

sentences.english: The team made an enormous effort.
sentences.chinese: 该队付出了巨大的努力。

detailed_translations.english: very big in size or in amount

sentences.english: Is there enough room for me?
sentences.chinese: 有足够的地方给我吗？

sentences.english: We didn't leave early enough.
sentences.chinese: 我们离开得不够早。

detailed_translations.english: used before plural or uncountable nouns to mean ‘as many or as much as sb needs or wants ’
to the necessary degree

sentences.english: We are pleased to receive your enquiry.
sentences.chinese: 我们很高兴收到您的询问函。

sentences.english: She has taken my enquiry as a personal affront.
sentences.chinese: 她将我的询问当成了人身侮辱。

sentences.english: When fresh supplies come into the market, we can revert to your enquiry.
sentences.chinese: 等新货上市时，我们才能回头考虑你们的询盘。

name: ensure
trans: 确保，保证，担保；保证给予

sentences.english: facilities to ensure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to make certain that something will happen properly

sentences.english: Knock before you enter.
sentences.chinese: 进来前先敲门。

sentences.english: The rebels were prepared to enter negotiations (= start discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子愿意参加谈判。

detailed_translations.english: to come or go into sth

name: entertain
trans: 招待，款待；使...娱乐，使有兴趣

sentences.english: A museum should aim to entertain as well as educate.
sentences.chinese: 博物馆应该致力于成为娱乐和教育功能并重的场所。

sentences.english: Mark usually does the cooking when we entertain.
sentences.chinese: 我们招待客人时通常都是马克下厨。

sentences.english: Do you get an allowance for entertaining clients?
sentences.chinese: 你招待客户有补助吗？

detailed_translations.english: to amuse or interest people in a way that gives them pleasure

name: entertainment
trans: 招待，款待，娱乐；文娱节目，娱乐性表演

sentences.english: The town provides a wide choice of entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 该镇提供各式各样的娱乐活动。

sentences.english: There will be live entertainment (= performed then, not recorded ) throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 现场表演将持续一整天。

sentences.english: The dolphins give good entertainment value (= a lot of amusement and interest ).
sentences.chinese: 海豚具有很高的娱乐价值。

detailed_translations.chinese: 娱乐， 文娱节目， 表演会； 招待， 款待， 请客
detailed_translations.english: things such as films, television, performances etc that are intended to amuse or interest people

name: enthusiasm
trans: 热情， 热心， 热忱； 巨大兴趣

sentences.english: Gillian and Darren greeted the speakers with great enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 吉利恩和达伦非常热情地接待了演讲者。

sentences.english: We went along to the local diving club, full of enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 我们兴高采烈地去了当地的潜水俱乐部。

sentences.english: They go about their tasks with little enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 他们执行任务时没多大干劲。

sentences.english: A delay of two hours did not dampen their enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 耽误了两小时没有减弱他们的热情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热情， 热心， 热忱； 巨大兴趣
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of interest and enjoyment about something and an eagerness to be involved in it

name: enthusiastic
trans: adj. 热情的；热心的；狂热的

sentences.english: an enthusiastic supporter of reform
sentences.chinese: 改革的热心支持者

detailed_translations.english: feeling or showing a lot of interest and excitement about something

sentences.english: It was the worst day in my entire life.
sentences.chinese: 那是我一生中最糟糕的一天。

sentences.english: The entire staff agreed.
sentences.chinese: 全体员工都同意了。

sentences.english: Have you drunk the entire bottle?
sentences.chinese: 你把整瓶酒都喝了吗？

detailed_translations.english: used when you want to emphasize that you mean all of a group, period of time, amount etc

sentences.english: Our situation is entirely different.
sentences.chinese: 我们的处境完全不同。

sentences.english: The ridge consists entirely of volcanic rock.
sentences.chinese: 这处山脊完全由火山岩构成。

sentences.english: Her reasons were not entirely clear.
sentences.chinese: 她的理由不是很明确。

detailed_translations.english: completely and in every possible way

sentences.english: the station entrance
sentences.chinese: 车站的入口处

sentences.english: Bridget made a dramatic entrance into the room.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特动作夸张地进了房间。

detailed_translations.english: a door, gate etc that you go through to enter a place

sentences.english: You can leave your umbrella in the entry.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把伞放在入口处。

sentences.english: More keyboarding staff are required for data entry.
sentences.chinese: 需要更多的键盘录入人员来录入这些资料。

sentences.english: There was no sign of a forced entry.
sentences.chinese: 没有强行闯入的迹象。

sentences.english: How did the thieves gain entry (= get in )?
sentences.chinese: 窃贼是怎样进入的？

detailed_translations.english: a door, gate or passage where you enter a building; an entrance hall

name: environment
trans: 环境，外界，客观环境；自然环境，生态环境

sentences.english: Some of these chemicals are very damaging to the environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些化学品中有些对环境非常有害。

sentences.english: legislation to protect the environment
sentences.chinese: 保护环境的法规

sentences.english: the effects of acid rain on the environment
sentences.chinese: 酸雨对环境的影响

sentences.english: the government minister for the environment
sentences.chinese: 负责环境事务的政府部长

detailed_translations.english: the air, water, and land on Earth, which is affected by man’s activities

name: environmental
trans: adj. 环境的，周围的；有关环境的

sentences.english: the environmental damage caused by the chemical industry
sentences.chinese: 化学工业对环境造成的破坏

sentences.english: an international meeting to discuss environmental issues
sentences.chinese: 探讨环境问题的国际会议

sentences.english: the environmental impact of pollution from cars
sentences.chinese: 汽车造成的污染对环境的影响

sentences.english: an environmental group
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织

detailed_translations.english: concerning or affecting the air, land, or water on Earth

name: episode
trans: 片断，一段情节；（连续剧的）一集

sentences.english: I'd like to try and forget the whole episode.
sentences.chinese: 我倒想尽量把那段经历全部忘掉。

sentences.english: One of the funniest episodes in the book occurs in Chapter 6.
sentences.chinese: 书中最有趣的片段之一在第6章。

detailed_translations.chinese: （人生的）一段经历；（小说的）片段，插曲
detailed_translations.english: an event, a situation, or a period of time in sb's life, a novel, etc. that is important or interesting in some way

name: equal
trans: 对手；匹敌；同辈；相等的事物

sentences.english: Both candidates received an equal number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 两位候选人的得票数相等。

sentences.english: I’m not sure he’s equal to the task.
sentences.chinese: 我不确定他是否能胜任这项任务。

sentences.english: He treats all his staff as equals.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有员工都一视同仁。

sentences.english: Two plus two equals four.
sentences.chinese: 二加二等于四。

detailed_translations.english: the same in size, number, amount, value etc as something else
someone who is as important, intelligent etc as you are, or who has the same rights and opportunities as you do
to be exactly the same in size, number, or amount as something else

name: equally
trans: adv. 同样地；相等地，平等地；公平地

sentences.english: You must have a good education, but practical training is equally important.
sentences.chinese: 你必须接受良好的教育，不过实际培训也同样重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同样地；相等地，平等地；公平地
detailed_translations.english: to the same degree or amount

sentences.english: a shop selling camping equipment
sentences.chinese: 出售露营装备的商店

sentences.english: some brand new computer equipment
sentences.chinese: 一些全新的计算机设备

sentences.english: a very useful piece of equipment
sentences.chinese: 一件非常有用的设备

sentences.english: A lot of money was spent on the equipment of the new hospital.
sentences.chinese: 新医院的装备花费巨大。

detailed_translations.english: the tools, machines etc that you need to do a particular job or activity

sentences.english: There must be an error in our calculations.
sentences.chinese: 我们的计算肯定有错。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake

sentences.english: He broke down the locked door and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他砸开上锁的门，逃走了。

sentences.english: Vents allow any steam to escape if the system overheats.
sentences.chinese: 如果系统过热，排放口可使蒸汽逸出。

sentences.english: The girl had no chance of escape.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩没有机会逃跑。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
